v.v: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,
“Should not such a multitude of words be answered?
Should your boasting make others remain silent?
For you say to God, ‘My beliefs are pure,
But, oh, that God would speak
that he would show you the secrets of wisdom!
Can you understand God by searching for him?
The matter is as high as heaven; what can you do?
Its measure is longer than the earth,
If he passes through and shuts anyone up,
For he knows false people;
But foolish people have no understanding;
But suppose that you had set your heart right
suppose that iniquity were in your hand, but that then you put it far away from you,
Then you would certainly lift up your face without a sign of shame;
You would forget your misery;
Your life would be brighter than the noonday;
You would be secure because there is hope;
Also you would lie down in rest, and none would make you afraid;
But the eyes of wicked people will fail;

v: Should this man, so full of talk, be believed?
When you mock, will no one make you feel ashamed?
I am blameless in your eyes.’
and open his lips against you;
For he is great in understanding.
Know then that God demands from you less than your iniquity deserves.
Can you comprehend the Almighty perfectly?
It is deeper than Sheol; what can you know?
and wider than the sea.
if he calls anyone to judgment, then who can stop him?
when he sees iniquity, does he not notice it?
they will get it when a wild donkey gives birth to a man.
and had reached out with your hands toward God;
and did not let unrighteousness live in your tents.
indeed, you would be steadfast and would not fear.
you would remember it only like waters that have flowed away.
though there were darkness, it would become like the morning.
indeed, you would find safety about you and would take your rest in safety.
indeed, many would seek your favor.
they will have no way to flee;
their only hope will be a last gasp of life.”
